caption.p: Diagram of impact assessment due to changes in climatology and perturbation. The triangles and circles indicate the boundary conditions and corresponding RCM outputs for each experiment, respectively. Δ is the future precipitation change estimated using the direct dynamical downscaling (DDS) method. Δ P and Δ C represent the contributions of changes in the perturbation and climatology, respectively. The expected climate change is defined by the sum of Δ P 0 and Δ C 0. Δ cp is the difference between the actual and expected future climates
